channel.title: Comments on: SQL Saturday #118 Wisconsin: They Came, They Sawâ€¦Did They Tip Cows?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Nancy Hidy Wilson
item.dc:creator: Nancy Hidy Wilson
item.content:encoded:
Jes,
So glad to hear that your first event went so well. Sounds like you hit some of the same first-timer issues that we did last year. So, we need to find a better way to communicate our learnings. From what I’ve read of our SQLSat107 (Houston) eval forms so far – it was a hit. But, the planning team knows all too well were we missed the mark – and you’ll find that you are much harder on yourself than the attendees are. As several people remarked to me this weekend, they were pleasantly surprised at the quality of this FREE event. So now we’ve raised their expectations for the next time!
Hope to see you are SQLRally or Summit! Keep up the good work!
Nancy Hidy Wilson
Houston Area SQL Server User Group, Chapter Leader

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.content:encoded:
@Tim – Thanks, and we’ll see you next year!

@Sri – Glad to hear #sqlsat107 was a success. Good luck with Rally!

@Audrey – Thanks for coming!

@Eric – If the DB thing doesn’t work out, I was going to be a chef. Maybe I can combine the two?!

@Gene – Thanks for helping out! You were one of the awesome volunteers.

@Rob – Good luck today!

@Steve – Thank YOU for coming from MN and speaking!

item.title: By: Steve Hughes (DataOnWheels)
item.dc:creator: Steve Hughes (DataOnWheels)
item.description: Awesome event Jes. Thanks for letting me speak.
item.content:encoded: Awesome event Jes. Thanks for letting me speak.

item.title: By: Rob Farley
item.dc:creator: Rob Farley
item.description: Nicely done, Jes. Mine's today... I'm speaking twice.
item.content:encoded: Nicely done, Jes. Mine’s today… I’m speaking twice.

item.title: By: genomon
item.dc:creator: genomon
item.description: You are definitely "The Bomb". Impressive array of speakers and organization. Thank you for this - can't wait 'til next time!
item.content:encoded: You are definitely “The Bomb”. Impressive array of speakers and organization. Thank you for this – can’t wait ’til next time!

item.title: By: Eric Selje
item.dc:creator: Eric Selje
item.content:encoded:
Thank you Jes for being the perpetual motion machine that kept everything running. You’re amazing, and have a future in event planning once this database fad runs dry.

And thank you for choosing me to speak as well. It was an honor to be among such amazing presenters and knowledge.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
I really wish I can be there, it sounds like a great event and I didn’t even know the date of it!

In any case, I really hope there will be an event in a future (not on Saturday) I can also attend.

item.title: By: Audrey Hogan
item.dc:creator: Audrey Hogan
item.content:encoded:
I agree with Mike Hillwig. One idea and one person making the commitment for this event along with ALL of the volunteers making their commitment made this day happen. After looking for people who do or are interested in sql makes a boatload of difference. And finding so many people out there, given the opportunity to meet some people having an understanding is awesome! Everything was great and learned a ton of stuff. also some stuff i thought i was doing properly but found inefficiencies. I could go on but that is the sum of it.

Thank You, Thank You to all the volunteers and Thank You to the Sponsors who made the event possible.

item.title: By: Sri
item.dc:creator: Sri
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jes,
Looks like your event went fantastic. I would have made it to yours but my Texas loyalty took me to Houston SQLSat which went very well too.

I agree with all your comments. Also on the vendor 4imprint. They are simply the best out there.

Used them for 3 events and the 4th one on the horizon ( sqlrally ).

Sri

item.title: By: Tim Costello
item.dc:creator: Tim Costello
item.description: Sounds like an amazing event! I wish I could have been there, I'll definitely be there next year. - @TimCost
item.content:encoded: Sounds like an amazing event! I wish I could have been there, I’ll definitely be there next year. – @TimCost
